home.infoP1: A groundbreaking 2018 study called The American Gut Project revealed that people who consume at least 30 different types of plant-based foods each week enjoy a more diverse gut microbiome. This diversity could be key to better digestion, stronger immune system, and even enhanced brain function. According to the study, by steadily incorporating a wide range of vegetables into your diet, you can reduce inflammation, improve nutrient absorption, and boost your overall vitality.
home.infoP2: Eat Your Veggies is a free app for tracking plant-based ingredients in your meals. The app requires no registration and the data is kept in your own device's browser cache.
home.infoP3: Don't miss out on the benefits of a diverse diet. Transform your health today with the help of Eat Your Veggies and experience the difference that plant diversity can make.
home.callout: Adopt a healthy lifestyle by eating 30 plant-based ingredients each week. Track your progress easily with this free app.

appPurpose.title: What's this app for?
appPurpose.text: Eat Your Veggies is a free app for tracking plant-based ingredients in your diet. Whenever you eat plant-based ingredients, or "veggies", you can search them in the app and add them to your weekly record. Each veggie counts only once per week.

categories.title: But strawberry is a...
categories.text: ...false fruit, I know. Also tomato is not a vegetable in biological sense, so the app takes some liberties in its categories. Still, please report any major inaccuracies you come across! You can also request missing veggies to be added. They should be such that are commercially available globally.

contact.title: How to get in touch?
contact.text: Our {0} profile features app updates and veggie facts, and you can contact us there. Thank you for your interest towards the project!

howToInstall.title: How to install?
howToInstall.text:
Android users can install our app from {0}.

Others can install the app from a browser that supports Progressive Web Apps (PWAs). Select "Add to start screen" from your browser's menu or click the install icon on the location bar. On mobile Safari, click "Share" and then "Add to home screen". Installing on device allows offline use, but keeps the app within your browser's sandbox.

isItFree.title: Is the app monetized?
isItFree.text: The app is free to use, and it has no advertisements. There will be a possibility to donate, but don't feel obliged.

isMyDataSafe.title: Is my data safe?
isMyDataSafe.text: The data is stored in your browser's local storage and is not shared with any third parties. You can at any time you wish reset the app using the button below.

studyDetails.title: What's the science?
studyDetails.text: According to a study, consuming 30 or more veggies weekly has multiple health benefits over a less versatile diet. The key, according to study, is not just the amounts you consume, but also variation. If you want to read more about the study, look up The American Gut Project from the journal of {0}.

whatCounts.title: What counts as a portion?
whatCounts.text: Ultimately, how you use the app is up to your discretion. However, consider that minuscule amounts might not be of any nutritional value. It is also worth noting that very processed foods don't count towards a portion. So ketchup should not equal a tomato.

settings.allergensInfo: Veggies marked as allergens won't show up in the app.

exportImport.description: Use this feature to back up and restore your data. Common use cases are if you want to clear your browser's cache, or change your phone or default browser.
exportImport.failure: Unexpected error. Data may be corrupted.
exportImport.label: Export or import app data

reset.label: Remove all data from the app
reset.text: Continuing with the reset will wipe all your previously saved data and start from scratch. This action cannot be undone.
reset.title: Are you sure you want to reset?
